thread.title: Rutgers to host NJSIAA boys hoops tourney finals
thread.title_full: Rutgers to host NJSIAA boys hoops tourney finals

author: app.com
title: Rutgers to host NJSIAA boys hoops tourney finals
text:
MORE The tradeoff for keeping the NJSIAA boys basketball public school state championships and non-public school sectional finals at the Rutgers Athletics Center is that some fans will have to pay more for admission to those games.
Adult ticket prices will increase from $5 to $8, while tickets for students and seniors have dropped from $3 to $2 under a new ticket-pricing structure the State Department of Education approved.
In addition, all spectators will still be charged $10 for parking at the RAC.
Based on last yearâ€™s ticket sales, the NJSIAA stands to make an additional $5,594 in revenue from the gate under the restructured prices.
Under a state law which limits the amount the NJSIAA can charge for championship events, the statewide athletics association can petition the State Commissioner of Education to increase ticket prices, showing its expenses at certain venues are exceeding its revenues.
The NJSIAA, in an Aug. 14 press release, announced that it was moving the boys basketball finals from Rutgers to Pine Belt Arena in Toms River, in part because it was losing money playing those games at the state university.
Assemblyman John Burzichelli, who authored the ticket-pricing legislation, intervened, helping to bring Rutgers and NJSIAA officials together in the hope that a deal could be brokered to keep the games at the state university.
After paying officials and event staff, the NJSIAA actually lost $2,447 contesting boys basketball championship games at Rutgers University last year, according to expense/revenue reports the statewide athletics association provided to Gannett New Jersey.
